medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced syncope after standing up to walk to the bathroom. His wife heard a thud and found him on the floor, having sustained facial trauma. There were no prodromal symptoms reported, but he did regain consciousness after chest compressions for a few seconds.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Multivessel coronary artery disease with history of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest 13 years prior, coronary-artery bypass grafting (CABG), history of hypertension, dyslipidemia, gout, varicose veins, and venous insufficiency. He underwent a knee replacement 9 months previously.
medical_history.family_history: Father died from a myocardial infarction at 56 years, mother died from colon cancer at 76 years.
medical_history.social_history: Long-term alcohol consumption (typically 8 to 12 beers daily), current smoker (up to 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years), lives with wife, employed as a mechanic, no history of illicit drug use.
